name: Czech Republic
description-1: In 2023, Czech-Republic had a GDP per capita of US$30,427 and a total population of 10.83 million people.
description-2: Czech-Republic established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 2049. Czech-Republic was ranked 17th in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 94/100.

Media.evidence: Prague Times 布拉格时报, and Czech-Chinese Journal 捷华通讯. They are significant within the diaspora context, not the whole society, so this depends on your definition of significant in this area.
Media.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence:
The founder and owner of Czech alternative media outlet General News joined a delegation of journalists from Central and Eastern Europe to visit visit China in 2024. The group visited the China International Press Communication Center (中国国际新闻交流中心) which offers training to foreign journalists. The delegation was invited to the PRC by the China-Central and Eastern European Countries Cooperation Secretariat (中国—中东欧国家合作秘书处).
Former Czech Prime Minister Jiří Paroubek, who is an active commentator and blogger on the Czech internet , occasionally visits the PRC. However, financing of his journeys has not been disclosed.
Media.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence:
The founder and owner of Czech alternative media outlet General News joined a delegation of journalists from Central and Eastern Europe to visit visit China in 2024. The group visited the China International Press Communication Center (中国国际新闻交流中心) which offers training to foreign journalists. The delegation was invited to the PRC by the China-Central and Eastern European Countries Cooperation Secretariat (中国—中东欧国家合作秘书处).
Former Czech Prime Minister Jiří Paroubek, who is an active commentator and blogger on the Czech internet , occasionally visits the PRC. However, financing of his journeys has not been disclosed.
Media.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: China Radio International broadcasts in Czech, but remains a fringe media organization.
Media.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: Prague Times 布拉格时报, and Czech-Chinese Journal 捷华通讯 are owned by PRC-connected individuals or entities. They are significant within the diaspora context, not the whole society. However, the PPF Group, a Czech company with strong business interests in the PRC, owns through the CME Group TV Nova, which runs several TV stations belonging to the most followed TV platforms in the Czech Republic.
Media.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: Literární noviny magazine has a cooperation agreement with Guangming Ribao and frequently reprinted its content in its section Reading China+. The magazine received a direct funding from the Guangming Ribao. However, the whole magazine officially terminated its operations in 2020 and last articles were published in 2022. Local radio stations Hey and Color cooperate with the CRI and frequently air shows about China.
Media.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.note: However, the PRC in the past exercised a direct pressure through CEFC. It also exerted an indirect pressure through the PPF group having interests in China. Project Sinopsis was subject to public denunciation and lawsuit.
Media.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: Former Czech Prime Minister Jiří Paroubek is acting like an online influencer and he occasionally denounces human rights abuses in the PRC. His articles are however published in controversial media and remain a fringe opinion within the Czech Republic. The alternative media outlet General News publishes Czech translations of articles from PRC media such as CRI, CGTN or Xinhua.
Media.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.note: The European Parliament Member Jan Zahradil (ODS) was a head of an EU-PRC joint parliamentary friendship group. He had reportedly halted the operation of the group in 2021 after he was subject to huge criticism.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: The Strategic Partnership was signed in 2016, but since 2021 the politics towards the PRC has changed and China is currently rather called ”systemic rival”.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Czech Republic has rejected PRC`s claim through former NATO general (and current president) Petr Pavel. However, at the same time, then Speaker of the Chamber of Deputies Jan Hamáček orally questioned the legality of such tribunal.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: The Senate of the Parliament of the Czech Republic has been very vocal about the violation of human rights in Xinjiang.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: The Senate and the Chamber of Deputies of the Parliament of the Czech Republic have been very vocal about the violation of human rights in Tibet.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: The Senate of the Parliament of the Czech Republic has publicly opposed the PRC’s repression in Hong Kong.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Vysoká škola technická a ekonomická in České Budějovice has established a research partnership with Huawei in 2016. The cooperation is probably still active, although does not result in any significant outcome. Another partnership is ongoing between Huawei and Technická univerzita (Ostrava). Other partnerships with PRC tech companies were terminated after National Cyber and Information Security Agency released its warning about such companies.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: As the Confucius Institute in Palace University (Olomouc) was closed in 2023, the Confucius institute at Vysoká kola finanční a správní (Praha) remains the only one in the Czech Republic. There are two Confucius Classrooms, one in Vysoká kola technická a ekonomická (České Budějovice), and Technická univerzita (Ostrava).
Academia.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Miloš Balabán, Czech Social Democratic Party (a former government party) security expert and formerly of Charles University's Centre for Security Policy and university's Czech-Chinese centre, received funds for his China-related lectures from the PRC embassy. He did so without notifying the university as he received the funds through his private company which shared its name with the Centre for Security Policy. The center is closed since 2019.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is only one known case of a Czech scholar participating in a talent program.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Such activities cannot be confirmed from publicly available sources, but some non-public sources suggest it could be even 3 to 4. There was one case of a professor specializing in explosives cooperating with the PRC entities.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: However, there was a case when a Czech Academy of Science fellow of PRC nationality physically attacked his colleagues for talking about Tibet and Dalai Lama during a public event aimed at children.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: Miloš Balabán, Czech Social Democratic Party (a former government party) security expert and formerly of Charles University's Centre for Security Policy and university's Czech-Chinese centre, received funds for his China-related lectures from the PRC embassy. He did so without notifying the university as he received the funds through his private company which shared its name with the Centre for Security Policy. The Centre was running several classes. The center is closed since 2019.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: These deals are often fringe and lead to nowhere, especially for the given time-frame.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Yes, but these ties have grown unimportant and non-active in the last years.

Domestic Politics.evidence: The Czech MP Marek Novák of the ANO party went to the PRC on a trip organized by the Shenzhen Chamber of Commerce. He also later admitted that he’d met with Huawei representatives while in China and discussed the forthcoming Czech cybersecurity law with them.
Domestic Politics.note:
Former Czech MEP Jan Zahradil was frequently flying to the PRC reportedly on the PRC expenses during his office. (https://sinopsis.cz/en/ep/)
Former President Miloš Zeman traveled to the PRC several times. In one case, he took a private jet of the PPF company which had huge business interests in the PRC at that time. (https://www.irozhlas.cz/zpravy-domov/zeman-byl-v-cine-s-miliardarem-kellnerem-na-cestu-zpet-vyuzil-prezident-letadlo-ppf_201410281309_akottova)
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.note: After the failure of the “restart” of the Czech-Chinese relations, contacts with the PRC are rare on all levels.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: In the recent past (previous Parliament), only Jan Skopeček (ODS) attended the ILD’s Dialogue of Political Parties. Members of the SPD were also invited. Radek Vondráček (ANO) also met with ILD's representatives, claiming he didn't know about their affiliation. The two parties with the most frequent contacts with the ILD, ČSSD and KSČM, are currently not represented in the Chamber of Deputies.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Although there are some parties which might have been supported by the PRC entities, there is no evidence.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence:
The late President of the Senate Jaroslav Kubera was harassed over his plans to visit Taiwan. The pressure was channeled through Czech politicians including president Zeman, and business (mainly PPF), but also the PRC embassy in Prague. The pressure was incredibly strong and President Kubera died before traveling to Taiwan, reportedly due to the tremendous stress, just after seeing a PRC ambassador. The event had a substantial impact on the further development of Czech politics, as it led Kubera’s successor Miloš Vystrčil to double-down on his intention to visit Taiwan. 

The PRC officials harassed Hsiao Bi-khim, the then Taiwanese vice president elect, who was visiting Prague in March 2024. While she was escorted from the airport to the hotel, the PRC military attaché was chasing her in a car and nearly caused the car crash. Although she is a Taiwanese politician, she was about to meet Czech politicians and was receiving the protection from Czech police, so this can be interpreted as a form of harassment.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Since the end of President Zeman`s term, expressing positive views of the CCP has gradually became a fringe opinion.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Especially former politicians have been employed by PRC state-owned companies or entities close to the PRC party-state organs. The clearest proponent of this trend is former minister Jaroslav Tvrdík, who until 2024 held important positions in the Citic Europe Holding and some of the companies it acquired.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: After Prague Mayor Zdeněk Hřib criticized the sister cities agreements between Prague and Chinese cities, and signed a new sister city agreement with Taipei, the PRC cancelled the tours of several music troupes, whose name contain the word ”Prague”. The PRC also cancelled direct flights between Prague and Beijing, Shanghai, and Chengdu, but that was, however, due to the Covid pandemic.

Technology.evidence: All the telecoms operating use the Huawei components in their cellular networks, Vodafone uses them even in the core network.

Technology.evidence: According to its own words, Huawei is cooperating with all the major internet providers in the Czech Republic. While the major providers are reluctantly moving toward getting rid of Huawei components, smaller providers are still dependent on Huawei technologies.

Technology.evidence: Surveillance systems have been provided by Hikvision to police, military, hospitals, etc. Huawei has provided segments of digital infrastructure to the Ministry of the Interior and other state and state-owned entities.

Law Enforcement.evidence: There was just one exception when General Secretary Xi Jinping visited Prague in 2016. The organized groups of Chinese people were attacking the protesters against Xi`s visit, while the police either did not help, or participated in hiding the Tibetan and Uyghur flags.
